Class MessageQueue

  • java.lang.Object

extends Object
    Queue messages for transmission
    Author:
    stella

      • getDepth

        public int getDepth()
        Returns:
        the depth of the queue

      • getBytes

        public long getBytes()
        Returns:
        the approximate number of bytes on the queue

        public void addTail(Message message)

      • peekNext

        public Message peekNext()
        Peek at the next message
        Returns:
        the next message or null

      • waitNext

        public Message waitNext()
                 throws InterruptedException
        Blocking wait for next message. This method will always return a Message or throw InterruptedException. The message is not removed from the queue.
        Returns:
        Message (never null)
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • waitNext

        public Message waitNext(long millis)
                 throws InterruptedException
        Returns the next message on the queue, waiting for at most millis. This only does one blocking call to wait, so calling code should manage nulls and loops. Does not remove the message.
        Parameters:
        millis -
        Returns:
        The next message or null
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • remove

        public void remove(Message message)
        Remove an existing message from the queue. Only the first identitical message is removed. Typical usage of this method would be in conjunction with waitNext() to peek at the next message and then remove it once processed.
        Parameters:
        message -
